title: PM Modi meets President Murmu
content: The meeting comes in the backdrop of the logjam in Parliament over the Opposition demand for a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision exercise in Bihar ahead of the Assembly elections in the State

title: Attack on pastor: Sulthan Bathery police register suo motu case
content: The assault reportedly spearheaded by a group of Bajrang Dal activists took place at Cherukad in Wayanad district on April 2, 2025 alleging religious conversion attempts

title: In a village of silence, her violin continues to sing for 80 years
content: Born in 1934, Meenakshi Subramanian is probably one of the last musicians of her generation from the composite Thanjavur district to have remained confined to her village — more precisely, within the four walls of her home — whilst others migrated to Chennai.

title: People are happy with implementation of Talliki Vandanam scheme: Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
content: Along with Minister for Home V. Anitha, Kondapalli Srinivas inaugurated newly constructed primary school in Pusapatirega of Vizianagaram district on August 3

title: Buffer zones around water bodies across Karnataka proposed to be reduced
content: Karnataka Land Conservation and Development Authority says reduction in buffer zone to promote infrastructure development and not real estate

title: Party ‘insiders’ behind the unpalatable comments against me, says TRS MLC Kavitha
content: Kavitha said the government is yet to give permission on her BC dharna on August 4 but hoped that the High Court would protect her rights

title: Senior Bihar Congress leader Ashok Kumar joins JD(U)
content: The Congress party has no respect for Dalits, and the party has remained as only a B-team of the Rashtriya Janata Dal, alleged Ashok Kumar (Ram)

title: Suvendu Adhikari claims 1 crore 'Rohingya, Bangladeshi, fake voters' present in Bengal, urges ECI to take action
content: SIR is a regular practice of the Election Commission of India. Even in the year 2002, the SIR exercise was carried out in West Bengal. Names of 20 lakh voters were removed from the voter list, says Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar

title: Two killed as SUV falls into gorge in J&K Kathua
content: All five passengers were en route to the campsite at Chanderkote along the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway when the accident occurred near Kainta Morh

title: U.P. CM Adityanath deploys Ministers across 12 flood-hit districts
content: The Chief Minister directed all Ministers in charge to immediately visit their assigned districts, inspect relief camps, and directly engage with affected families. He instructed senior officials—including DMs, SPs, and CMOs—to stay on the ground and ensure 24x7 monitoring.

title: Anti-terror operation in Jammu & Kashmir’s Kulgam enters third day

title: More than 20 lakh Assam farmers get ₹422 crore under PM-KISAN scheme
content: The amount was disbursed as part of a nationwide programme, which was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Varanasi,” a senior official of the Agriculture Department said

title: ‘Sanatan Dharma has ruined India’, says NCP-SCP MLA Jitendra Awhad after Malegaon verdict
content: Sanatan Dharma has ruined India. There was never any religion called Sanatan Dharma. We are followers of Hindu Dharma. It was this so-called Sanatan Dharma that denied our Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj his coronation, says NCP-SCP MLA Jitendra Awhad

title: Kannur’s ‘two-rupee doctor’ A.K. Rairu Gopal passes away at 80; leaves behind legacy of compassion and service
content: For over 50 years, Dr. Rairu Gopal stood as a beacon of hope for the common people, charging just ₹2 for a consultation and often providing free medicine to those in financial distress

title: Unscientific mining pushing Uttarakhand's Bageshwar toward disasters: Govt panel to NGT
content: According to the report, most mines have altered natural slopes through steep vertical cuts and lack proper benches, making the terrain highly "vulnerable to landslides" and rockfalls.

title: Mother, two minor daughters beaten to death by miscreants in Samarlakota in Kakinada district
content: The Kakinada divisional police rushed to the spot and the bodies have been sent to Kakinada Government General Hospital for post-mortem

title: ‘Strong suspicion, no legal proof’: Why all 7 accused in 2008 Malegaon bomb blast case walked free
content: Special Judge A.K. Lahoti said that while it was proven that a bomb blast had taken place, the prosecution failed to present reliable evidence to prove that the seven accused were behind it

title: ECI’s SIR exercise is ‘an insult to migrant workers and gross interference in right of electorate in Tamil Nadu’: Chidambaram
content: “If the migrant worker’s family has a permanent home in Bihar and lives in Bihar, how can the migrant worker be considered as ‘permanently migrated’ to Tamil Nadu?” asks Mr. Chidambaram

title: He has his reasons: Shashi Tharoor on Rahul Gandhi's 'dead economy' remark
content: The remarks came after Rahul Gandhi on July 31 agreed with Donald Trump’s statement that the Indian economy is “dead” and said he is “glad” that the US President has stated a fact

title: News In Frames | Konkan’s own derby
content: Despite heavy rain and a red alert, villages in Ratnagiri turned up in large numbers for the traditional Naangarni Spardha, where farmers race their prized oxen

title: MNS workers vandalise dance bar in Navi Mumbai
content: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers vandalise the ‘Night Riders Bar’ on the outskirts of Panvel in Navi Mumbai, sparking outrage and police investigation

title: Eight hundred students from Northeast visit ISRO facilities in Bengaluru
content: The students visited as part of the North East Students’ Programme for Awareness, Reach, and Knowledge on Space Programme

title: A new district flood severity index factors in flood impact on people
content: Researchers from IIT Delhi and IIT Gandhinagar have come up with a District Flood Severity Index (DFSI) that takes into account the mean duration in days of all flooding events in a district, percentage of area that is historically flooded, total number of deaths, number of people injured, and the population in the district

title: Woman’s mutilated body found in U.P.'s Bijnor
content: The police suspect the woman was attacked by a leopard, forest officials believe it to be a case of murder, with the body later mauled by an animal

title: Ancient Hindu idols recovered during excavation at a spring in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district
content: The Public Works Department is undertaking revival and restoration works in the spring and the labourers recovered the idols during the excavation work

title: 78 students in Chhattisgarh given anti-rabies injections after dog contaminates mid-day meal; probe on
content: The students narrated the incident to their families, after which parents and villagers approached the school, including its management committee chairperson Jhalendra Sahu, for clarification

title: Tirunelveli killing: When caste pride slays young love
content: The recent killing of C. Kavin Selvaganesh, a Scheduled Caste youth, just because he was in love with a girl of an intermediate caste, has again spotlighted rampant caste pride in southern Tamil Nadu. P. Sudhakar and C. Palanivel Rajan examine the specific circumstances leading to the murder and also highlight the caste hegemony in the region

title: Hitec City road buckles under tech traffic boom, clogs with 1.5 lakh vehicles per day
content: The road caters to approximately five lakh IT employees per day with 7,000 vehicles per hour in a single direction during peak hours

title: Infant dies after falling into stagnant water at their waterlogged house in Kolkata’s Dum Dum area
content: This development comes as State residents complain about bad road conditions and incessant waterlogging issues on pivotal areas

title: West Bengal government and Centre are not keen for resumption of MGNREGA, despite Calcuttal HC order
content: Neither of the governments is willing to resume the scheme when West Bengal is facing a huge migrant crisis, with millions leaving the State in search of work

title: Focus is on promoting event management sector to boost tourism, says A.P. Minister
content: Tourism Policy aims at increasing the sector’s contribution to the State’s GDP from 4.6% to 8% and creating 2 lakh new jobs, says Kandula Durgesh

title: Prajwal Revanna rape case: We will register more cases if survivors come forward even now, says SIT Chief B.K. Singh
content: The victim in the case was from the lowest strata of society, socially and economically, while the accused was from the most powerful political family of the State, said Mr. Singh

title: India’s logistics cost will be down to less than 10% by December: Gadkari
content: The Union Minister virtually lays foundation for 27 road projects and inaugurates two others costing about ₹5,235 crore in Andhra Pradesh

title: Bird deaths raise red flags as India expands wind energy
content: Across seven multi-season surveys, Wildlife Institute of India researchers searched for bird carcasses within a 150-m radius of 90 randomly selected wind turbines and found 124

title: Gulmarg’s famous 137-year-old Nedous hotel served eviction notice
content: The family had earned multiple leases from the government till 1985, but failed to renew the same after its expiration in 1985. The J&K government rejected the lease in February 2015.

title: Simpler tests could slash biosimilar costs, widen patient access
content: For many years, a debate has raged over how much proof is required for a manufacturer to prove that a given biosimilar will work as well as the original biologic

title: PM Modi Meets President Murmu Amid Parliament Disruptions
content: The meeting comes in the backdrop of the logjam in Parliament over the opposition demand for a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise in Bihar ahead of the Assembly elections in the state.

title: Kerala Doctor Who Charged Rs 2 Dies At 80
content: Dr AK Ryru Gopal, affectionately known as the "Two Rupee Doctor" for his decades-long service to the poor and underprivileged, passed away on Sunday.

title: "It's That Face, Those Lips": Trump's Praise For White House Secretary Sparks Row
content: US President Donald Trump offered high praise for his White House Press Secretary, Karoline Leavitt, commenting on her "face" and "lips."

title: Behind Army Officer Assaulting SpiceJet Staff, 16-Kg Cabin Luggage Problem
content: A senior Army officer's refusal to pay for 16-kg cabin luggage -- more than double the permitted limit of 7 kg -- snowballed into an assault that left four SpiceJet employees with serious injuries, including a spinal fracture and a broken jaw.

title: Days After High Court Order, 1st Case Filed For Feeding Pigeons In Mumbai
content: The court had cited serious public health risks, including respiratory infections and environmental degradation, caused by unchecked pigeon congregations.

title: Pahalgam Terrorist's Funeral In PoK Takes Unexpected Turn
content: The funeral of Habib Tahir, one of the terrorists behind the April 22 strike who was killed in Jammu & Kashmir, was held in his village in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) last week.

title: 11 Dead, Many Injured As SUV Falls Into Canal In Uttar Pradesh
content: Eyewitnesses, who saw the vehicle sinking, immediately alerted the local police station, while others informed the village head (Gram Pradhan).

title: Meet Indian-Origin Mathura Sridharan, Ohio's New Solicitor General Facing Flak For 'Bindi'
content: Indian-origin lawyer Mathura Sridharan has been appointed Ohio's 12th Solicitor General, Attorney General Dave Yost has announced.

title: "Digging My Own Grave": Israeli Hostage Breaks Down Inside Hamas Tunnel
content: A video released by the Palestinian group Hamas shows an Israeli hostage visibly emaciated, digging what he describes as his own grave in an underground tunnel.

title: 7 Seniors Detained For Sexually Assaulting Class 6 Boy At Assam School
content: Seven Class 11 students of a central government-run school in Assam's Kamrup district have been detained for the alleged sexual assault of a Class 6 boy for months.

title: Video: Drunk Army Man Drives Car Onto Railway Platform In Meerut
content: An Army man has been arrested for driving his car onto the platform of Meerut Cantt railway station, dangerously close to a train, the police said. The incident, captured on camera, surfaced online on Friday and has since gone viral.

title: UP Woman Stabs Husband With Knife, He Claims 'Found Her With Lover At Home'
content: The police, however, said that Saira attacked her husband while they were fighting over his alcohol drinking habit.

title: Yamuna Nears Warning Level In Delhi, Rivers Breach Danger Mark Across UP
content: The water level of Yamuna in Delhi has reached 204.14 metres, drawing close to warning level of 204.5 metres. Authorities in several districts of Uttar Pradesh are also on high alert as rivers are flowing at or above danger levels.

title: Shashi Tharoor Was Asked Who Would Be Next Vice President. His Response
content: The election for the next Vice President will be held on September 9, and the notification will be issued on August 7, the Election Commission said.

title: Drunk Mumbai Cop Misbehaves With Women In Ladies Compartment, Arrested
content: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly misbehaving with a woman passenger in a drunken condition in the ladies' compartment of a local train in Mumbai. The incident occurred last afternoon in the Borivali-Vasai slow local train.

title: "Money More Important Than Blood": MP Slams BCCI Over India-Pak Match
content: The Asian Cricket Council has announced the schedule for the Asia Cup, including the "Blockbuster fixture" India-Pakistan match

title: Puri Burn Case: Teen Dies, Cops Say No One Involved, Father Releases Video
content: Hours after a teenager from Odisha died of severe burn injuries at AIIMS Delhi, new developments have added a twist to the Puri Balanga minor burn case.

title: 4 Of Indian-Origin Family Go Missing In US, Last Seen At Burger Shop
content: Asha Divan (85), Kishore Divan (89), Shailesh Divan (86), and Gita Divan (84) were travelling from Buffalo to Prabhupada's Palace of Gold in Marshall County, West Virginia.

title: Dog Bites Spike In Noida, Health Department Flags 34 Danger Zones
content: The health department has flagged 34 hotspots for dog bites across Uttar Pradesh's Noidadistrict. According to official figures, 69,188 dog bite cases were reported between January and May this year.

title: Validation, Loneliness, Insecurity: Why Young People Are Turning To ChatGPT
content: An alarming trend of young adolescents turning to artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots like ChatGPT to express their deepest emotions and personal problems is raising serious concerns among educators and mental health professionals.

title: Sell only Swadeshi goods, PM Modi exhorts Indian traders amid ‘global economic uncertainty’
content: The Prime Minister's remarks came just days after U.S. President Donald Trump called India a "dead economy"

title: Why is northeast on edge about Assam evictions? | Explained

title: Waterborne freight transport resumes in Assam after 10 years

content: He was speaking on bridging the ‘digital gap’ and ‘reimagining legal aid in the digital age for inclusive justice in India’ at the Justice RC Lahoti Memorial Lecture

content: A group led by Celtics minority owner Steve Pagliuca has a deal in place to buy the WNBA's Connecticut Sun for a record $325 million and plans to move the team to Boston, a source confirmed to ESPN.

content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: ‘Jaws broken, spine fractured’: SpiceJet staff assaulted by army official; airline responds
content: In Srinagar Airport on July 26, 2025, a senior Army official allegedly assaulted four SpiceJet employees after being asked to pay for excess baggage. The airline reports severe injuries to its staff, including spinal fractures and jaw injuries, resulting from punches, kicks, and use of a queue stand.

title: Missing for days: 4 Indian-origin senior citizens killed in US car crash
content: An Indian-origin family of four, travelling from Buffalo to Pittsburgh, has gone missing, prompting a search operation. Asha, Kishore, Shailesh, and Gita Divan were headed to West Virginia after stopping at a Burger King in Erie, Pennsylvania. Their cell phones are unanswered since Tuesday, and they never checked into their pre-booked lodging.

title: 'I'm going to propose to you': WCL owner's Live TV act leaves presenter stunned
content: South Africa Champions secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over Pakistan Champions in the World Championship of Legends final, propelled by AB de Villiers' stunning century. Off the field, league owner Harshit Tomar proposed to presenter Karishma Kotak live on air, creating a viral moment.

title: Bill Gates: AI today can replace human work; but it is not …
content: Bill Gates believes AI is rapidly advancing, capable of handling simple coding tasks but not yet the most complex ones. Experts disagree on whether AI will master complex coding within two years or a decade. Gates highlights AI's potential to replace telesales jobs, impacting various sectors.

title: 'He had two EPIC nos': BJP on Tejashwi's 'missing name' claim; asks did he have 2 voter IDs?
content: The BJP has accused RJD of electoral roll tampering in Bihar, alleging RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav possesses multiple voter IDs. This accusation follows Yadav's claim that his name was missing from the voter list, which the Election Commission refuted, confirming his name's presence.

title: UP accident: 11 devotees killed as SUV plunges into canal; CM announces Rs 5L aid
content: A tragic accident in Gonda district claimed the lives of 11 devotees from Seha village. Their SUV plunged into a canal near Belwa Bahuta while en route to the Prithvinath temple in Ayodhya for Jalabhishek. Four pilgrims were rescued.

title: Grow a Garden trading and cooking event: Full guide to recipes, rewards, & new features
content: Roblox's Grow a Garden has launched its Trading and Cooking Event Update, introducing a fully interactive cooking system and a new trading mechanism. Players can now prepare dishes using harvested crops and trade items more efficiently to unlock rare in-game rewards. The update also includes exclusive cosmetics and unique pets, enhancing the game’s farming-simulation experience.

title: 'I was a baby' – Gavaskar declares Gill’s 754 more valuable than his 774 -Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar lauded Shubman Gill's impressive 754 runs, acknowledging it surpassed his own achievements. Gavaskar presented Gill with a special shirt and autographed cap. The event followed Gill's tactical brilliance with Mohammed Siraj, dismissing Zak Crawley. Gavaskar also reminisced about his lucky jacket from the Gabba Test.

title: ‘Happen in Lagaan…’: Trump sees Pak selling oil to India! Reality of their reserves
content: Harsh Goenka mocked Donald Trump's suggestion of Pakistan selling oil to India, deeming it highly improbable. Trump claimed a deal with Pakistan to develop its 'massive' oil reserves, potentially leading to sales to India. However, Pakistan's proven reserves are significantly smaller than India's, and it heavily relies on oil imports, making Trump's scenario unlikely.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: 'For my mom and dad' - Emotional Jaiswal on scoring century in front of parents | Watch
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's resilient 118 in the second innings at The Oval propelled India to a total of 396 against England. The emotional knock, his second century of the series, was witnessed by his parents for the first time. Jaiswal expressed gratitude for performing in front of them, marking the moment with a celebratory gesture.

title: Granite quarry collapse: 6 workers dead, 10 injured in Andhra; rescue ops on
content: A devastating rockslide at a granite quarry in Bapatla district claimed the lives of six workers and left ten others seriously injured. The incident occurred at the Satyakrishna Granite Quarry near Ballikurava, trapping workers under a collapsed portion of rocks. Rescue operations are underway to recover the remaining bodies, while the injured receive treatment at Narasaraopet Government Hospital.

title: Himachal monsoon havoc: 173 dead, highways shut; IMD warns of more rainfall
content: Himachal Pradesh is reeling from relentless rain, resulting in blocked roads, power outages, and disrupted water supplies, with Chamba, Kullu, Mandi, and Una being the worst-hit districts. The monsoon season has claimed 173 lives, with a significant number attributed to landslides and flash floods.

title: Meet Arvinder Singh Bahal: 80-yr-old space tourist on Blue Origin flight; launching August 3
content: Agra's 80-year-old Arvinder Singh Bahal, a seasoned traveler, is set to embark on Blue Origin's New Shepard NS-34 mission on August 3, 2025. Having explored all 196 countries, Bahal's space journey symbolizes his lifelong curiosity. Blue Origin's suborbital flight will take Bahal and other passengers beyond Earth's atmosphere from West Texas.

title: Vaughan slams Pietersen: 'He’s talking nonsense' - all you need to know
content: A social media clash erupted after Kevin Pietersen claimed Test batting was tougher 20 years ago, listing legendary bowlers and challenging fans to name modern equivalents. Michael Vaughan countered, asserting current bowlers are equally skilled. He highlighted India's seamers, Australia's trio, and South Africa's Rabada and Jansen, praising the competitiveness of recent Test cricket and the quality of today's bowlers.

title: 'Let departed rest in peace': BJP fumes over Rahul's Jaitley 'threatened' him claim
content: Rahul Gandhi's claim that Arun Jaitley threatened him over farm laws has sparked controversy, drawing strong condemnation from BJP leaders and Jaitley's son, Rohan. They refuted the claim, citing Jaitley's death in 2019, before the laws were introduced. Critics accuse Gandhi of making baseless allegations and disrespecting the deceased leader.

title: Watch: Sundar Pichai gets taste of something new during IND vs ENG 5th Test
content: During the fifth Test between India and England, Google CEO Sundar Pichai surprised fans by joining the commentary box alongside Harsha Bhogle. Pichai shared his childhood cricket memories and admiration for Gavaskar and Sachin. Coincidentally, Washington Sundar's counterattack coincided with Pichai's commentary, adding a delightful twist to the day's events. He also predicted a 2-2 series tie.

title: Happy Friendship Day 2025: Best Messages, quotes, wishes, greetings card to share on Friendship Day
content: Friendship Day 2025 is approaching, offering a chance to strengthen bonds with cherished friends. The day encourages reconnecting with old acquaintances, expressing gratitude to current companions, and celebrating meaningful relationships through heartfelt gestures. From sharing nostalgic photos to planning themed parties or virtual meetups, the focus remains on appreciating the invaluable role friends play in life's journey.

title: Watch: 41-yo ABD flaunts his 'aura' in viral celebration after WCL 2025 title
content: AB de Villiers, at 41, showcased his enduring brilliance by scoring a match-winning century in the World Championship of Legends final, leading South Africa Champions to victory over Pakistan Champions. Following the win, de Villiers joined Wayne Parnell in recreating the viral "aura farming" dance, delighting fans.

title: Guns, Jeans, and Republican: How Sydney Sweeney became MAGA's new muse
content: In an era where even a sneeze can be interpreted as a political statement, Sydney Sweeney has become the conservative darling of the year—without attending a single rally or issuing a single press release. The star of Euphoria and The White Lotus has, quite by accident, become a MAGA icon. All it took was a leaked Republican voter registration, a denim ad campaign misread as a white supremacist dog whistle, and a shooting range video that could’ve doubled as NRA propaganda. Welcome to 2025, where political identity is crafted less by what you say, and more by which side claims you.

title: Earthquake hits New Jersey; tremors felt across parts of New York
content: A magnitude 3.0 earthquake rattled parts of New Jersey and New York on Saturday night, with the epicenter near Hasbrouck Heights, New Jersey. Tremors were felt across New York City and northern New Jersey, causing brief but intense jolts.

title: Chhattisgarh: 78 kids served mid-day meal partially eaten by stray dog
content: In Chhattisgarh's Balodabazar district, 78 students received anti-rabies vaccines after allegedly consuming mid-day meals contaminated by a stray dog. Despite students' and teachers' concerns, the self-help group responsible for the meals served the food, prompting outrage from parents and villagers.

title: Vice president election: Will government consult opposition? What Tharoor said
content: The Election Commission has announced that the 17th vice presidential election will be held on September 9. The official notification will be issued on August 7, and candidates can file nomination papers until August 21.

title: Twist in Odisha case: Teen dies, police say girl 'set herself on fire'
content: A 15-year-old girl from Puri, Odisha, with severe burn injuries, has died at AIIMS New Delhi after initially claiming she was attacked. Police investigation, including a video-graphed statement to a magistrate, indicates she set herself ablaze. Despite efforts by medical teams and government support, she succumbed to her injuries, prompting condolences from state officials.

title: Official! Pakistan impose blanket ban on future WCL participation - details inside
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has officially banned participation in future World Championship of Legends tournaments, citing biased treatment from WCL following India Legends' withdrawal from their semi-final match against Pakistan. The PCB criticised WCL's response as hypocritical, accusing them of prioritising political and commercial interests over sporting neutrality and fair play.

title: Trump's 25% tariff sparks order cancellation fears; exporters seek govt aid
content: Indian businesses are worried about potential order cancellations from American clients due to the new 25% duty on Indian goods, exceeding rates for competitor nations. During discussions with Minister Piyush Goyal, sectors like textiles, steel, and agriculture requested support, including an Export Promotion Mission and US market assistance.

title: Akash Deep’s day out at The Oval: – '66 is no less than a century' - Watch
content: Akash Deep's maiden half-century and his century partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal propelled India to 189 for three at lunch on Day 3 of the final Test against England. Akash Deep's aggressive 66 off 94 balls, marked by boundaries and powerful slogs, earned him appreciation from teammates and praise for his contribution. Jaiswal remained unbeaten on 85, solidifying India's position.

title: India may face up to $11 bn extra import cost if Russia trade is cut: Analysts
content: Amidst potential US penalties and EU sanctions, India faces a complex challenge in its Russian oil trade. A shift away from discounted Russian crude could inflate India's import bill by billions, impacting refiners and potentially destabilizing retail fuel prices. Despite claims, India continues to procure Russian oil, balancing economic factors with international norms.

title: Priyanka Chaturvedi targets govt, BCCI after India-Pak Asia Cup match confirmed
content: Priyanka Chaturvedi has strongly criticized the Indian government and the BCCI for prioritizing financial gains over national security by proceeding with the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match. She highlighted the hypocrisy of the decision following the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Chaturvedi condemned the BCCI's revenue from the match as "cursed money," given the recent cross-border hostilities and civilian casualties.

title: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle enjoy beach day with son Archie in California
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle enjoyed a family day at Santa Claus Beach in Carpinteria, California, with their son Prince Archie. The six-year-old was seen taking surfing lessons, following in his father's footsteps. Meghan and Harry relaxed on the beach, engaging with other beachgoers, while Princess Lilibet was absent from the outing.

title: 'He has his reasons': Tharoor sidesteps Rahul Gandhi's 'dead economy' remark; raises trade concerns
content: Shashi Tharoor declined to comment on Rahul Gandhi's agreement with Donald Trump's assessment of the Indian economy. Tharoor emphasized the importance of maintaining strong economic ties with the US, highlighting India's significant exports. He urged support for negotiators to secure a fair deal for India and advocated for exploring alternative export regions.

title: IND vs ENG: Washington and Prasidh creates a unique history - Details inside
content: Washington Sundar and Prasidh Krishna's unbeaten 39-run partnership set a record for India, with Sundar scoring all the runs. Jaiswal's century, along with half-centuries from Akash Deep, Jadeja, and Sundar, propelled India to set a 374-run target against England. Siraj dismissed Zak Crawley late in the day, giving India an early breakthrough as England closed play at 50 for one.

title: AP liquor scam: Video shows YSRCP leader’s aide counting bundles of cash
content: A special investigation team (SIT) has retrieved incriminating video footage in the multi-crore liquor scam, intensifying its legal and political ramifications. The video shows Venkatesh Naidu, a close aide of YSRCP leader Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy, counting large sums of cash suspected from illegal liquor trade and electoral operations.

title: 3 runs needed in 1 ball! Holder pulls off last-ball heroic vs Pakistan - Watch
content: Jason Holder's exceptional all-round performance propelled West Indies to a thrilling two-wicket victory over Pakistan in the second T20I, levelling the series. Holder's 4/19 restricted Pakistan to 133, while crucial contributions from Gudakesh Motie and Romario Shepherd kept West Indies in the hunt. Holder sealed the win with a final-ball boundary, marking West Indies' first T20 success in seven matches.

title: WWE SummerSlam 2025 Night 1 results: Winners, shocking moments, injuries, and highlights
content: SummerSlam 2025 Night 1 witnessed Seth Rollins' shocking Money in the Bank cash-in on CM Punk, stealing the World Heavyweight Title. Roman Reigns and Jey Uso triumphed over Breakker and Reed, while McIntyre and Paul defeated Jelly Roll and Orton. Flair and Bliss captured the Women’s Tag Team Titles, and Stratton retained her title against Cargill. And finally, Sami Zayn outlasted Karrion Kross in a singles bout.

title: Prajwal Revanna case: SIT chief says ‘survivor stood like a rock’
content: SIT chief BK Singh commended the rape survivor's resilience in the Prajwal Revanna case, highlighting her crucial testimony despite the four-year gap since the offences. The investigation involved extensive evidence and witnesses, with officials affirming no external interference. The swift judicial process led to Prajwal's conviction on all counts within just over a year.

title: Who is Matt Deitke? 24-year-old AI genius who rejected Meta’s $125 million offer
content: Matt Deitke, a 24-year-old AI prodigy, initially rejected a $125 million offer from Meta. Mark Zuckerberg intervened, doubling the offer to $250 million. Deitke's work at AI2 on Molmo, a multimodal chatbot, earned him recognition. He also co-founded Vercept, an AI agent startup. Meta's pursuit highlights the intense competition for top AI talent. Deitke ultimately accepted Meta's unprecedented offer.

title: IPL | CSK have a few holes to plug in mini auction: MS Dhoni
content: Chennai Super Kings, after a disappointing IPL 2025 season, found some late optimism with injury replacements. MS Dhoni believes the batting order is now sorted for the next edition with Ruturaj Gaikwad's return.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England skipper says Siraj brings Kohli-Rohit-like intensity - 'He lifts the team'
content: Nasser Hussain praises Mohammed Siraj's relentless energy and fighting spirit, comparing his impact on the Indian team to that of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Despite injuries to key players and workload management concerns, Siraj has bowled tirelessly, picking up 18 wickets and demonstrating exceptional fitness.

title: Mid-air assault: Man slapped during ‘panic attack’ on IndiGo flight found
content: IndiGo has banned a passenger from its flights for 30 days after he assaulted a co-passenger on a Mumbai-Kolkata flight. The incident, which involved Hafijul Rahaman slapping Hossain Ahmed Majumder, occurred after Majumder experienced a panic attack. Police are investigating, and other airlines may also impose no-fly restrictions. Majumder is currently traveling back home to Cachar by train.

title: Loan fraud case: ED proof confirms use of fake docs
content: Enforcement Directorate arrested Partha Biswal, MD of Biswal Tradelink Pvt Ltd, concerning a Rs 68-crore fake bank guarantee provided by Reliance ADAG to SECI. Reliance Power Ltd allegedly paid Rs 5.4 crore to Biswal's company for the fraudulent guarantee, using forged documents. Anil Ambani has been summoned for questioning, and a lookout circular has been issued against him.

title: Watch: Hilarious! Jadeja asks England spectator to change t-shirt during IND vs ENG 5th Test
content: During the fifth Test at The Oval, Ravindra Jadeja playfully requested a spectator to change his red t-shirt, which was interfering with his sightline. The fan obliged, earning cheers and a thumbs-up from Jadeja. Meanwhile, India dominated Day 3, propelled by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and crucial lower-order runs, setting England a challenging target.

title: 2K Games details gameplay changes for NBA 2K26
content: the ProPLAY Motion Engine has overhauled how players move on the court . the engine will reduce the phenomenon of players "skating" over the floor . this also includes a new collision system that aims to be more reliable than motion capture animations used previously .

title: WWE SummerSlam Night 1 results: Seth Rollins cashes in on CM Punk, becomes new champion
content: CM Punk defeated Gunther to become the new WWE world heavyweight champion . he had won a gauntlet match last month on "Raw" to earn the right to challenge him . former members of the Bloodline, cousins Roman Reigns and Jey Uso team up .

title: Indians in Ireland urged to take ‘reasonable precautions’ after growing number of racist attacks against foreigners

title: How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Washington Commanders owner Josh Harris addressed reporters after striking one of the biggest deals in recent franchise history . Harris wore the expression of an athlete who had just won a big game . he grew up a fan of the team he bought from previous owner Dan Snyder for $6.05 billion in 2023 .

title: How will Miller and Suarez split closing duties?
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . former Rays starter Blake Snell has not toed a major league rubber since early April . the veteran lefty has been sidelined with left shoulder inflammation .

title: Oscar Piastri on qualifying: 'Bizarre' and 'frustrating'
content: car's Charles Leclerc takes pole at the hungarian grand prix . championship leader Piastri was just 0.026 seconds off the racer . he was quickest in final practice earlier on friday .

content: the busiest 60 days of the annual recruiting calendar are officially behind us . 155 prospects in the 2026 ESPN 300 made commitments in an avalanche of summer recruiting business from June 1 to July 31 . only 16 uncommitteds remain in the ESPN 300 as of Saturday morning .

content: if there is anyone inside the Minnesota Vikings organization with a license to speak freely about J.J. McCarthy, it's Justin Jefferson . the team's star receiver spent the offseason working with his new quarterback . "you definitely have to have patience," Jefferson says .

content: quarterback dak Prescott and receiver ceeDee Lamb didn't get their respective new deals done until close to the season . on friday, parsons posted on social media that he is requesting a trade . "i no longer want to play for the Dallas Cowboys," he wrote .

content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . there's no team to beat in the American League, Bradford Doolittle says .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: Malegaon blast case: Key docs mysteriously vanished; original statements of witnesses lost
content: Armed with a degree in political science and law, Rebecca Samervel waltzed into journalism after a brief stint in modeling. As a reporter at The Times of India, Mumbai, she covers courts. She is a self-confessed food-a-holic. Travelling, politics and television are her passions. If you want to find her during the week the only place to look is the Bombay high court.
